conclusion: Determine the length of the transparent part of the light entering perpendicular to the vertical diameter MN on the hemispherical lens.
The light source is located at the focal point F of the paraboloid.
Light emitted from the source is reflected by the paraboloid and enters the hemispherical lens perpendicular to the vertical diameter MN.
The refractive index of the lens material is n = 4/3.
The lens is hemispherical with radius R.
The vertical diameter MN is the axis of symmetry for the hemisphere.
Light entering perpendicular to MN implies that it travels along the radius of the hemisphere.
Since the light is perpendicular to the surface at the point of entry, it will not refract at the air-lens interface due to normal incidence.
The transparent part of the lens is the portion of the spherical surface that allows light to pass through without being blocked by the light-blocking plate.
Since the light enters perpendicular to MN, it travels along the radius and exits at the opposite point on the spherical surface.
The transparent part of the lens is the arc of the hemisphere that corresponds to the angle subtended by the light path.
Since the light enters and exits along the diameter, the transparent part is essentially the full diameter of the hemisphere.
The length of the transparent part is equal to the diameter of the hemisphere, which is 2R.
